channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish from local restaurants, 14th August
item.description:
Local restaurants are dumping hard rubbish. Its been like this for 2 weeks, with more items added every couple of days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Standard Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not enough bins. Multiple businesses and homes., 14th August
item.description:
Been ongoing for many years. I keep reporting the problem to the landlord. There is flytipping but also not enough bins for the commercial businesses and residents. There is now a food business and a childrens centre so its a public health issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Timberwharf Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste on Pardoner street, 14th August
item.description:
There is dog waste on the pavement next to Tabard Street. This is becoming a problem with someone allowing their dog to foul on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pardoner Street, Walworth, London

item.title: No drop curb, 14th August
item.description:
Newly done pavement and crossing has no drop curb at crossing point. At both raglan road and conduit road cross section with Bloomfield road. There is however there is a drop curb on Bloomfield road of this intersection. All other intersections further up Bloomfield road have drop curbs at all 4 crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raglan Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug dealing and addicts, 14th August
item.description:
There has been a massive up surge in the number of drug addicts using and gathering in Hackney Downs. There is also very visible drug dealing happening. Lots of fights and drama created / associated with the addicts along with all the 'litter'.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footpaths Across Hackney Downs, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown privet hedges trees blocking the pedestrian pavement, 14th August
item.description:
There are several houses in the Earlswood st that have Privet hedges trees that are too big and are blocking the pavement for pedestrians. There are places where the trees, plust bins and light posts are making it impossible to walk in the pavement. There are at least 10 houses that are not respecting the boundary of their property walls. They need to cut the parts that are blocking rhe pavement.. it is impossible to pass with wheelchair in this streer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Earlswood Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mid way down Albany St, 14th August
item.description:
Temp traffic lights due to roadworks. Vehicles in the queue on Albany Street are continually beeping. Illegal but of course no-one to enforce it. We can hear it on Redhill Street but there's a block right next to the queue which must drive the poor residents mad. This is one of of the reasons why we are dreading the expensive pavement widening imitative. We've got HS2 one side of us on Hampstead Road, Albany St is our only alternative bus route lots of elderly people and stabled people need nus stops nearby. Leave us, the road, the bus stops alone. We've had enough disruption with HS2 & Thames Water and Camdenn Council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
